poem:
### Essex Car Park

At Manningtree,  
on asphalt fields,  
the dormouse whispers  
beneath silvered shadows.  

Hazel dreams,  
fringed with hedgerow song,  
pause in the quiet rush.  

The hedgehog's pace—  
a needle's tip  
on landscape's canvas.  

Will the concrete  
find ears for the earth's murmur?  
We wait on this painted mark.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Essex car park to be test case for legislation to protect landscapes A commuter car park in Essex is to be one of the first test cases of whether the government will enforce new legislation aimed at protecting national parks and landscapes in England. Dedham Vale is a designated “national landscape” on the border of Essex and Suffolk, home to increasingly rare species including hazel dormice and hedgehogs.
